Courses.Name: ECE 2205A - ELECTRIC CIRCUITS
Description: Basic resistive circuits, Ohm's, Kirchhoff's Laws. DC analyis: nodal and mesh analysis. Network theorems: linearity, superposition, Thévenin's and Norton's theorems. Time-domain analysis: first and second order circuits, source-free and forced response. Sinusoidal steady-state analysis: phasors, complex power. Basic OpAmp circuitry.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 2 ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER OR MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B, Applied Mathematics 1411A/B, Applied Mathematics 1412A/B, Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YR 2 ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER OR MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B, Applied Mathematics 1411A/B, Applied Mathematics 1412A/B, Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 2231B - INTRO TO ELECTRONICS
Description: Electronic properties of semiconductors. The P-N junction. Diodes and light-emitting diodes; bipolar and field-effect transistors. Biasing, small signal analysis, large signal analysis. Single transistor amplifiers.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour, 1 laboratory hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL AND COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2205A/B, Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B or the former Physics 1026.
RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL AND COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2205A/B, Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B or the former Physics 1026.
HELD IN SEB 3107.
HELD IN SEB 3107.

Courses.Name: ECE 2233B - CIRCUITS AND SYSTEMS
Description: Introduction to a system level analysis of electrical circuits. The S-Plane and frequency response of circuits, frequency selective circuits, state variables, introduction to Fourier analysis, Fourier transform and Laplace transform techniques. Transfer functions and system functions.
Antirequisite(s): MSE 2233A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour, 1 laboratory hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL OR COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS. CROSS-LISTED WITH MSE 2233B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, ECE 2205A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2276A/B.
RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL OR COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS. CROSS-LISTED WITH MSE 2233B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, ECE 2205A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2276A/B.
RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL OR COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS. CROSS-LISTED WITH MSE 2233B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, ECE 2205A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2276A/B.
CROSS-LISTED WITH MSE 2233B.
HELD IN SEB 3107.

Courses.Name: ECE 2236B - MAGNTC CRCTS & TRANSMSSN LINES
Description: Three phase circuits, magnetic coupling and circuits, transformers. Transmission lines and the telegrapher equation.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 hour lab sessions (4 labs per term).

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL OR COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, ECE 2205A/B, Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2276A/B.
RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL OR COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B, ECE 2205A/B, Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B.
Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2276A/B.
HELD IN SEB 2093.
HELD IN SEB 2093.
HELD IN SEB 2093.

Courses.Name: ECE 2238B - INTRO TO ELECTRICAL ENGINEERNG
Description: DC circuit analysis, fundamentals of DC circuit analysis, Ohm's Law, KCL, KVL, Thévenin and Norton Equivalent circuits, maximum power transfer; linear analog circuits, diodes, transistors, operational amplifiers, biasing, gain, frequency response.
Antirequisite(s): ECE 2205A/B, ECE 2231A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour, 1 laboratory hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO SOFTWARE, GREEN PROCESS AND INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B, Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B.
RESTRICTED TO SOFTWARE, GREEN PROCESS AND INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B, Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B.
RESTRICTED TO SOFTWARE, GREEN PROCESS AND INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B, Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 2240A - ELECTRICAL LABORATORY I
Description: Laboratory experiments associated with ECE 2205A/B, as well as laboratory experiments in instrumentation and measurement; the lecture component includes review of laboratory practice, health and safety issues, simulation software, data collecting methods; errors and their calculus; accuracy; averaging, signal conditioning, and data interpolation.
Extra Information: 1 lecture hour, 3 laboratory hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL OR COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Computer Science 1026A/B or Engineering Science 1036A/B.
Corequisite(s): ECE 2205A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 2242B - PRINCIPLES OF DESIGN
Description: Introduction to electrical engineering design. Topics include the engineering design process, review of sensors and signal conditioning, digital system design, analog system design, programmable logic controllers (PLCs).
Extra Information: 2 lecture hour, 3 laboratory hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2240A/B, ECE 2277A/B, ECE 2205A/B.
Corequisite(s): ECE 2231A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 2277A - DIGITAL LOGIC SYSTEMS
Description: Theory of Boolean algebra, switching circuits, Venn diagrams; Karnaugh maps; logic and memory systems, design of combinational and sequential switching machines; electronic switching circuits; data coding, storage, transmission; basic design of digital computers.
Antirequisite(s): The former ECE 3339A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours, 1 tutorial.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO INTEGRATED, SOFTWARE, ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER AND MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B or the former Physics 1026.
Corequisite(s): ECE 2205A/B or registration in Integrated Engineering or Software Engineering Program.
RESTRICTED TO INTEGRATED, SOFTWARE, ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER AND MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Physics 1302A/B or Physics 1402A/B or the former Physics 1026.
Corequisite(s): ECE 2205A/B or registration in Integrated Engineering or Software Engineering Program.
RESTRICTED TO INTEGRATED, SOFTWARE, ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER AND MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: ECE 3330A - CONTROL SYSTEMS
Description: The concept of feedbacks; modelling of dynamic systems; characteristics of feedback control systems, performance of control systems in time and frequency domains; stability of feedback systems; control system analysis and design. Using root locus and frequency response techniques.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 3310A/B
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL, MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B and (ECE 2233A/B or MSE 2233A/B)
RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL, MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2270A/B and (ECE 2233A/B or MSE 2233A/B)
HELD IN ACEB 4415.
HELD IN ACEB 4415.
HELD IN ACEB 4415.
HELD IN ACEB 4415.
HELD IN ACEB 4415.

Courses.Name: ECE 3331B - INTRO TO SIGNAL PROCESSING
Description: Introduction to discrete-time signals and sampled data, linear time-invariant (LTI) systems, frequency response, discrete Fourier transforms, convolution, spectrum analysis, Z-transforms, non-recursive digital filters.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER AND MECHATRONIC ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2233A/B or MSE 2233A/B.
RESTRICTED TO ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER AND MECHATRONIC ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2233A/B or MSE 2233A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 3332A - ELECTRIC MACHINES
Description: Basic Principles related to magnetic fields and energy conversion, transformers, DC machines, synchronous machines, induction Machines, special purpose motors.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS, MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 4 COMPUTER OPTION A STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): (ECE 2233A/B and ECE 2236A/B) or (MSE 2201A/B and MSE 2233A/B).
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS, MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND YR 4 COMPUTER OPTION A STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): (ECE 2233A/B and ECE 2236A/B) or (MSE 2201A/B and MSE 2233A/B).
HELD IN SEB 2093.
HELD IN SEB 2093.

Courses.Name: ECE 3333B - ELECTRIC POWER SYSTEMS I
Description: Per unit System; three phase transmission systems; three phase transformers; transmission line parameters; steady state operation of transmission lines; maximum power flow; reactive power compensation; economic operation of power systems.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hour, 1.5 tutorial hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS  AND YR 4 COMPUTER OPTION A STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2236A/B, ECE 3332A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS  AND YR 4 COMPUTER OPTION A STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2236A/B, ECE 3332A/B.
HELD IN SEB 2093.

Courses.Name: ECE 3336B - ELECTROMAGNETIC THEORY
Description: Radio-frequency transmission lines, telegrapher's equations, Smith chart. A vector treatment of the theory of electric and magnetic fields. Integral and differential forms of Maxwell's equations. Boundary conditions. Scalar and vector potentials, reflection and transmission of electromagnetic waves in dielectric and conducting media.
Antirequisite(s): Physics 3300A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 ELECTRICAL OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2276A/B, Applied Mathematics 3415A/B, ECE 2233A/B, ECE 2236A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 ELECTRICAL OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Applied Mathematics 2276A/B, Applied Mathematics 3415A/B, ECE 2233A/B, ECE 2236A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 3337A - ELECTRONIC CIRCUITS
Description: Frequency response in electronic circuits, zener diode and power supply (voltage regulator) circuits, power amplifiers, differential amplifiers, feedback circuits, miscellaneous topics (Miller effect, current mirrors, cascade and cascode circuits, etc.)
Antirequisite(s): The former ECE 2235A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 ELECTRICAL OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 4 COMPUTER OPTION A ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2205A/B, ECE 2231A/B, ECE 2233A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 ELECTRICAL OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 4 COMPUTER OPTION A ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2205A/B, ECE 2231A/B, ECE 2233A/B.
HELD IN SEB 3107.

Courses.Name: ECE 3349A - INTRODUCTION OF VLSI
Description: This course covers fundamentals of semiconductor physics as applied to microelectronics, theory of semiconductor materials and devices. Students will be exposed to basic elements of CMOS circuitry design, including practical implementation of resistors, capacitors, diodes, transistors and MOSFET. Related topics such as delays, cross-talk, parasitics, temperature effects are included.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 COMPUTER AND YR 4 ELECTRICAL OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 4 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Sceince 1021A/B, ECE 2233A/B, ECE 2240A/B, ECE 2231A/B, ECE 2277A/B or ES 1021A/B, ECE 2238A/B, ECE 2277A/B & successful completion of the 2nd yr of the Electrical or Computer Engineering or in Integrated Engineering
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 COMPUTER AND YR 4 ELECTRICAL OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 4 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Sceince 1021A/B, ECE 2233A/B, ECE 2240A/B, ECE 2231A/B, ECE 2277A/B or ES 1021A/B, ECE 2238A/B, ECE 2277A/B & successful completion of the 2nd yr of the Electrical or Computer Engineering or in Integrated Engineering

Courses.Name: ECE 3370B - ANALOG COMMUNICATIONS THEORY
Description: This course deals with fundamental principles of wireless RF communications, AM, FM, and PM modulation, demodulation and spectra, and frequency shifting and mixing. Practical linear and nonlinear circuits for a heterodyne radio receiver are studied, including RF/IF amplifiers, matching networks, oscillators, mixers, modulators, demodulators, and phased-locked loops.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 ELECTRICAL OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2231A/B, ECE 2233A/B, ECE 3337A/B
RESTRICTED TO YRS 3 & 4 ELECTRICAL OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2231A/B, ECE 2233A/B, ECE 3337A/B

Courses.Name: ECE 3374A - ELECTRONICS FOR MECH ENG
Description: This course deals with the study of electrical, electronic, and electromechanical devices and systems, including the theory of operation, and analysis of behaviour through modelling of components and systems.
Antirequisite(s): ECE 2274A/B, MSE 3302A/B, the former ECE 3373A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 MECHANICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS OR YR 3 INTEGRATED OR YR 2 INTEGRATED/HBA, INTEGRATED, OR MECHANICAL/HBA STUDENTS.
HELD IN SEB 3107.
HELD IN SEB 3107.

Courses.Name: ECE 3375B - MICROPROCESSORS & MICROCOMP
Description: Basic elements of computers: central processing unit; memories; input/output devices; interfacing, software and hardware design, Computer Assisted Design; data handling and process control equipment; applications of microprocessors.
Antirequisite(s): Computer Science 3350A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YRS 2, 3 & 4 ELECTRICAL OR COMPUTER OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 3 SOFTWARE OR YR 4 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2277A/B or the former ECE 3339A/B
RESTRICTED TO YRS 2, 3 & 4 ELECTRICAL OR COMPUTER OR YR 2 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 3 SOFTWARE OR YR 4 INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS AND MECHATRONIC SYSTEMS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2277A/B or the former ECE 3339A/B

Courses.Name: ECE 3380B - ADVANCED DIGITAL SYSTEMS
Description: Memory units, coders, decoders, adders, multipliers, clocks, synchronous and asynchronous sequential circuits, algorithmic state machines, microprogrammed synthesis of ASM designs, advanced microprocessor  organization.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2277A/B.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): ECE 3375A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2277A/B.
Pre-or Corequisite(s): ECE 3375A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 3389A - COMPUTER SYSTEM DESIGN
Description: Introduction to computer system design and the architecture of modern high-performance computers. Memory hierarchy. RISC, superscalar, and multi-core architectures. Microprogrammed and hardwired control implementations. Students will complete group design projects integrating these concepts.
Antirequisite(s): The former ECE 4470A/B, the former ECE 4489A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3375A/B and ECE 3380A/B, or completion of third year of the Software Engineering program.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3375A/B and ECE 3380A/B, or completion of third year of the Software Engineering program.
HELD IN ACEB 2400.

Courses.Name: ECE 3390B - HARDWARE/SOFTWARE CO-DESIGN
Description: Modern design techniques for embedded, wireless, and mobile computing systems. Unified approach to hardware and software design. Partitioning of systems into hardware and software. Hardware/software interface design. Trade-offs in hardware and software partitioning.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours

Notes: REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3389A/B.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3389A/B.
HELD IN ACEB 2400.

Courses.Name: ECE 3399B - DESIGN OF ELECTRONIC SYSTEMS
Description: Principles and Practices of Design of Electronic Systems is a third year design course in the Electrical Engineering Program. Topics include principles and practices of design of electronic systems through projects in the area of communications, microprocessors, control systems and signal processing.
Extra Information: 1 lecture hours, 3.0 laboratory hours.

Notes: REQUISITES: Pre-or Corequisite(s): ECE 3330A/B, ECE 3331A/B, ECE 3370A/B, ECE 3375A/B.
ALSO HELD IN ACEB 4415.
HELD IN ACEB 4415.
ALSO HELD IN ACEB 4415.
ALSO HELD IN ACEB 4415.

Courses.Name: ECE 4415 - COMPUTER ENG DESIGN PROJECT
Description: Selection and investigation of a computer engineering problem. Analytical and/or experimental work is carried out by project groups under the supervision of a faculty member. Progress report and a final engineering report are prepared. Each student must deliver a public oral presentation.
Antirequisites: CBE 4497, CEE 4441, ECE 4416, Engineering Science 4499, GPE 4497, MME 4499, MSE 4499, SE 4450.
Extra Information: 6 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Computer Engineering program.

Courses.Name: ECE 4416 - ELECTRICAL/COMPUTER PROJECT
Description: Selection and investigation of an engineering problem. Analytical and/or experimental work is carried out by individual students or project groups under the supervision of a faculty member. Progress reports and a final engineering report are prepared; each student must deliver a public lecture.
Antirequisite(s): CBE 4497, CEE 4441, MME 4499, SE 4450, Engineering Science 4499.
Extra Information: 6 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER, INTEGRATED ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Completion of third year of the Electrical, Computer or Integrated Engineering programs

Courses.Name: ECE 4429A - ADV DIGITAL SIGNAL PROCESSING
Description: Digital Signal Processing (DSP) is widely used in speech and audio processing, biomedical engineering, and telecommunication applications. The objectives of this course are to strengthen the students' knowledge of DSP fundamentals, to introduce them to advanced DSP topics, and to familiarize them with the practical aspects of DSP algorithm implementation.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL, MECHATRONICS, OR YR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3331A/B
ALSO HELD IN ACEB 2415.
ALSO HELD IN ACEB 1400.

Courses.Name: ECE 4436A - NETWORKING
Description: Introduction to networking, network architecture and protocols, layering, OSI and TCP/IP models. Physical layer: transmission media, data encoding, Asynchronous and synchronous transmission. Data link layer: error detection, flow control, error control. Packet Switching: datagrams, virtual circuits, routing, congestion control, internetworking. Local area networks, network layer and transport layer.
Antirequisite(s): Computer Science 3357A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 2 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL OR INTEGRATED OR YR 3 SOFTWARE OR YR 3 OR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL OR INTEGRATED OR YR 3 SOFTWARE OR YR 3 OR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): Engineering Science 1036A/B or Computer Science 1026A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 4437A - COMMUNICATIONS THEORY
Description: Introduction to communication systems and information theory. Classification of signals and systems. Communication channel modeling. Fourier series and transform applications. Modulation techniques. Sampling theory and digital transmission. Digital modulation, optimum receiver design, performance analysis. Error control. Selected topics.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 tutorial hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL OR YR 3 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3330A/B, ECE 3331A/B, ECE 3375A/B, Statistical Sciences 2141A/B or Statistical Sciences 2143A/B, Applied Mathematics 2276A/B or the former Applied Mathematics 2415.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL OR YR 3 ELECTRICAL/HBA OR YR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3330A/B, ECE 3331A/B, ECE 3375A/B, Statistical Sciences 2141A/B or Statistical Sciences 2143A/B, Applied Mathematics 2276A/B or the former Applied Mathematics 2415.

Courses.Name: ECE 4438B - ADV IMAGE PROCESSING & ANLYSIS
Description: This course explores a few major areas of digital image processing at an advanced level, with primary emphasis on medical applications.  Topics covered include image filtering and enhancement, visualization, image segmentation and image registration. Examples will be presented to give the students exposure to real-world applications in medicine and other applications.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL, MECHATRONICS, AND COMPUTER OPTION A & OPTION B ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 4445A/B or Medical Biophysics 4445A/B
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL, MECHATRONICS, AND COMPUTER OPTION A & OPTION B ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 4445A/B or Medical Biophysics 4445A/B

Courses.Name: ECE 4439B - CONVNTNL, RENEWBLE & NUC ENRGY
Description: Global energy resources, distribution and consumption. Sustainability. Principles of operation and control of thermal, nuclear, thermal and hydroelectric, photovoltaic solar and wind power plants. Distributed Generation (DG) and renewable energy technologies. Grid integration of distributed generation.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL OR YR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3333A/B, MME 2234A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL OR YR 4 COMPUTER ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3333A/B, MME 2234A/B.

Courses.Name: ECE 4445A - INTRO TO DIGITL IMAGE PROCSSNG
Description: This course covers the fundamentals of digital image processing, including image representation, histograms, contrast enhancement, geometric operations, registration, digital filtering and segmentation. Emphasis is placed on implementation of algorithms and on practical applications in industry, science and medicine.
Antirequisite(s): MEDBIO 4445A/B
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER OR MECHATRONICS ENGINEERING STUDENTS. CROSS-LISTED WITH MEDICAL BIOPHYSICS 4445A.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3331A/B
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER OR MECHATRONICS ENGINEERING STUDENTS. CROSS-LISTED WITH MEDICAL BIOPHYSICS 4445A.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3331A/B
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL, COMPUTER OR MECHATRONICS ENGINEERING STUDENTS. CROSS-LISTED WITH MEDICAL BIOPHYSICS 4445A.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3331A/B

Courses.Name: ECE 4455A - BIOMEDICAL SYSTEMS ANALYSIS
Description: An introduction to biomedical engineering organized around applications of linear and control systems analysis to the dynamics of physiological systems and their responses to diagnostic and therapeutic interventions. Emphasis will be placed on respiratory and cardiovascular physiology and interactions of those systems with medical devices.
Antirequisite(s): Medical Biophysics 4455A/B.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours.

Notes: CROSS-LISTED WITH MEDICAL BIOPHYSICS 4455A.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): (CBE 2221A/B or ECE 2233A/B or ECE 3374A/B or MSE 2233A/B) and (CBE 3310A/B or ECE 3330A/B or MME 3350A/B).

Courses.Name: ECE 4456B - POWER SYSTEM PROTECTION
Description: To allow students to: a) gain an understanding of the basic principles of protective relays and b) have a practical understanding of protection schemes for electrical power systems and equipment.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1 laboratory hour.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 4464A/B
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 4464A/B
HELD IN TEB 318.

Courses.Name: ECE 4457A - POWER ELECTRONICS
Description: The use of power semiconductor devices in converter structures (topologies) to process and control the flow of electric energy. The aim of the course is to familiarize students with various power electronic converter topologies and their applications.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 3 hour lab sessions (4 labs per term).

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL AND MECHATRONICS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2233A/B and ECE 3333A/B, or MSE 2233A/B and registration in the fourth year of the Mechatronic Systems Engineering program
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL AND MECHATRONICS ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 2233A/B and ECE 3333A/B, or MSE 2233A/B and registration in the fourth year of the Mechatronic Systems Engineering program
HELD IN SEB 2093.

Courses.Name: ECE 4460B - REAL-TIME & EMBEDDED SYSTEMS
Description: Review of embedded processors, memory systems, basic peripherals; real-time kernel configurations, task control blocks, interrupt service routines, real-time clocks/timers, multi-tasking, schedulability analysis, inter-task communication, signals, message queues, cooperative/pre-emptive multi-tasking, priority scheduling, priority inversion problems, timing considerations, deadline handing, input-output handling; practical issues in computer control; design, development, and testing techniques.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hours.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 COMPUTER, ELECTRICAL, MECHATRONICS OR SOFTWARE ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): (Computer Science 1027A/B or Computer Science 1037A/B or SE 2205A/B) and ECE 3375A/B.
RESTRICTED TO YR 3 & 4 COMPUTER, ELECTRICAL, MECHATRONICS OR SOFTWARE ENGINEERING STUDENTS.

Courses.Name: ECE 4464A - ELECTRIC POWER SYSTEMS II
Description: Power flow studies; symmetrical faults; symmetrical components; unsymmetrical faults; power system stability; Introduction to High Voltage DC (HVDC) Transmission and Flexible AC Transmission Systems (FACTS).
Extra Information: 3 Lecture hours/week, 1 Tutorial hour/ week; 1 lab hour/week.

Notes: RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3333A/B
RESTRICTED TO YR 4 ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING STUDENTS.
REQUISITES: Prerequisite(s): ECE 3333A/B
HELD IN TEB 318.

Courses.Name: ECE 4469B - APPLIED CONTROL SYSTEMS
Description: The course covers analytical methods for analyzing and developing control strategies for industrial processes. These include identification and empirical modeling, tuning of PID controller, digital control systems, z-transformation. PLCs are discussed. Computer based simulation modules using Matlab^® and Simulink^® reused. Examples from different engineering disciplines are studied.
Extra Information: 3 lecture hours, 1.5 laboratory hour.
